spell->Light.target: 1 Gegenstand von maximal 1 Last, den entweder niemand oder du oder ein bereitwilliger Verbündeter mit sich führt

action->Cruel Performance.name: Grausame Darbietung
action->Cruel Performance.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal am Tag

Effekt Der Barde kommentiert Dinge und Personen auf eine so grausame, einschneidende Weise, dass Blut fließt. Alle Gegner innerhalb von @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9 m} Entfernung erleiden @Damage[7d6[slashing]]{7W6 Punkte Hiebschaden} (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic]{einfacher Zähigkeitswurf}).

Clockwork Dancers.name: Mechanische Tänzer
Clockwork Dancers.description: Mehrere humanoide mechanische Figuren, die mit wirbelnden Klingen bewaffnet sind, bewegen sich durch den Bereich.
Clockwork Dancers.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25|traits:action:disable-a-device]{Diebeskunst} (Experte), um die Mechanismen an der Kontrolltafel zu deaktivieren; zwei Erfolge werden benötigt.
Clockwork Dancers.reset: Die Falle deaktiviert sich nach 4 Runden und setzt sich nach 1 weiteren Minute zurück.
Clockwork Dancers.routine: Jeder Mechanische Tänzer wählt eine Kreatur auf der Bühne innerhalb von 10 Fuß/3 m Entfernung zu einer Säule als Ziel eines Wirbelklingenangriffs.

action->Spring Attack.name: Wirbelangriff
action->Spring Attack.description:
Auslöser Eine Kreatur beendet ihren Zug in Bereich F2

Effekt Mechanische Figuren springen aus den Säulen und greifen jeden auf der Bühne mit wirbelnden Klingenangriffen an. Die Falle würfelt dann ihre Initiative aus.

Corrupted Draft.name: Korrumpierter Entwurf
Corrupted Draft.description: Kakophonische Musik, Dichtkunst und Tanz verbinden sich, um tiefgreifendes Misstrauen gegenüber Fremden aufzubauen.
Corrupted Draft.disable: @Check[performance|dc:28]{Darbietung}, um dem Auftritt entgegenzuwirken, oder @Check[religion|dc:28]{Religionskunde} oder @Check[occult|dc:28]{Okkultismus}, um die spirituellen Energien zu stören. Zwei Erfolge sind nötig, um die Falle auszuschalten. Der mechanische Kopf kann die Falle automatisch mit zwei Anwendungen von Inspirierendes Gedicht ausschalten.
Corrupted Draft.reset: Die Gefahr endet, wenn sich keine bei Bewusstsein befindlichen Kreaturen mehr in Bereich E3 aufhalten, und setzt sich nach 1 Minute zurück.
Corrupted Draft.routine:
(1 Aktion; Furcht, Gefühl, Mental, Okkult) Die Echos hallen nach und zerren an allen im Wirkungsbereich, während sie sie mit Misstrauen erfüllen. Alle Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]]{2W10+11 Punkte Mentalen Schaden} und müssen einen @Check[will|dc:28|traits:emotion,fear,mental,occult,damaging-effect]{Willenswurf} ablegen:

Kritischer Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen und 1 Minute lang gegen die Effekte der Falle immun.

Erfolg Das Ziel erleidet halben Schaden.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erleidet vollen Schaden und erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Kränkelnd 1} durch Gefühle des Misstrauens und der Anspannung.

Kritischer Fehlschlag Das Ziel erleidet doppelten Schaden und erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Kränkelnd 2}.

action->Sickening Performance.name: Furchtbare Darbietung
action->Sickening Performance.description:
Auslöser Zwei oder mehr Charaktere betreten Bereich E3 und machen dabei Geräusche

Effekt Worte, Laute und Geräusche werden verstärkt und zu einem entsetzlichen Kreischen vermengt. Alle Kreaturen im Wirkungsbereich erleiden @Damage[(2d10+11)[mental]]{2W10+11 Punkte Mentalen Schaden} (@Check[will|dc:28|basic]{einfacher Willenswurf}). Die Falle würfelt sodann ihre Initiative aus.

Deadly Workshop.name: Gefährliche Werkstatt
Deadly Workshop.description: Mit Klingen bewehrte Ketten peitschen durch die Werkstatt.
Deadly Workshop.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device]{Diebeskunst} (Experte), beim Kontrollpult auf der erhöhten Plattform, um die Falle auszuschalten.
Deadly Workshop.hpDetails: zur Zerstörung der Ketten (entschärft die Falle)
Deadly Workshop.reset: Die Falle deaktiviert sich nach 1 Minute und setzt sich dann zurück.
Deadly Workshop.routine: (1 Aktion) Die Falle schwingt eine Klinge gegen jede Kreatur in der Werkstatt. Die ganze Werkstatt zählt aufgrund der schieren Anzahl peitschender Ketten als Schwieriges Gelände. Die Falle erhält keinen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe.
Deadly Workshop.stealth: (Experte), um die an den Ketten befestigten Klingen und das komplexe System aus Flaschenzügen zwischen den Ketten zu bemerken.

action->Swinging Blades.name: Schwingende Klingen
action->Swinging Blades.description:
Auslöser Zwei oder mehr Kreaturen betreten die Werkstatt oder beenden ihren Zug in der Werkstatt

Effekt Die Falle führt einen Klingenangriff gegen die auslösenden Kreaturen und würfelt dann ihre Initiative.

action->No MAP.name: kein Malus für Mehrfachangriffe
action->No MAP.description: Diese Falle erleidet keinen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe.

Entangling Shredder Trap.name: Verstrickende Schneidseile
Entangling Shredder Trap.description: Dutzende Seile mit Stahlhaken schießen aus den Wänden, sobald wenigstens zwei Kreaturen auf die Teppiche treten.
Entangling Shredder Trap.hpDetails: um die Seile zu kappen und die Falle auszuschalten
Entangling Shredder Trap.stealth: (Experte), um die Druckplatten unter den Teppichen zu bemerken

action->Entangling Ropes.name: Verstrickende Seile
action->Entangling Ropes.description:
Auslöser Zwei Kreaturen betreten den Gang oder beenden ihren Zug dort

Effekt Die Falle führt einen Schneidseilangriff gegen die auslösenden Kreaturen aus. Diese Falle erhält keinen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe.

action->Grasping Ropes.name: Zupackende Seile
action->Grasping Ropes.description:
Die Seile wickeln sich um die Gliedmaßen des Zieles. Das Ziel muss einen @Check[reflex|dc:25]{Reflexwurf} ablegen:

Erfolg Das Ziel ist nicht betroffen.

Fehlschlag Das Ziel erhält den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Auf dem Falschen Fuß}, bis es die Seile durchtrennt oder @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Entkommen} (SG 25).

Kritischer Fehlschlag Wie beim Fehlschlag, aber das Ziel erhält zudem den Zustand @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Bewegungsunfähig}.

action->No MAP.name: kein Malus für Mehrfachangriffe
action->No MAP.description: Diese Falle erleidet keinen Malus für Mehrfachangriffe.

action->Prayer of Oblivion.name: Gebet der Auslöschung
action->Prayer of Oblivion.description:
Häufigkeit Einmal am Tag

Effekt Der Priester spricht ein Gebet an seine Gottheit, mit der er die Kräfte des Nichts anruft. Alle Feinde innerhalb von @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 Fuß/9 m} erleiden @Damage[5d6[void]]{5W6 Punkte Leerenschaden} (@Check[will|dc:21|basic]{einfacher Willenswurf}).

spell->Light.target: 1 Gegenstand von maximal 1 Last, den entweder niemand oder du oder ein bereitwilliger Verbündeter mit sich führt

spell->Magic Weapon.name: <Compendium>
spell->Magic Weapon.target: 1 Waffe, die entweder nicht getragen oder von dir oder einem bereitwilligen Verbündeten geführt wird

weapon->Staff of Conjuration.name: Zauberstecken der Beschwörung
weapon->Staff of Conjuration.description:
Dieser Stecken aus Eschenholz ist mit Tiersymbolen verziert; führst du ihn, so erhältst du einen Situationsbonus von +2 auf Fertigkeitswürfe zum Identifizieren von Beschwörungsmagie.

Aktivierung Zauber wirken

Effekt Du wendest die erforderliche Anzahl an Ladungen des Steckens auf, um einen Zauber von seiner Liste zu wirken.

  • Zaubertrick @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uZK2BYzPnxUBnDjr]{Verstrickende Ranke}
  • Grad 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Beschwörung eines Konstruktes}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk]{Phantomdiener}
  • Grad 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lpT6LotUaQPfinjj]{Beschwörung eines Elementars}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Beschwörung eines Konstruktes}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Wundersames Reittier}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm]{Nebel}

Herstellungsvoraussetzungen Jeweils ein Wirken jedes aufgeführten Zaubers mit dem aufgeführten Grad.

action->Pack Attack.name: Rudelangriff
action->Pack Attack.description: Kraschk fügt einer Kreatur zusätzliche 1W4 Schadenspunkte zu, sofern diese sich innerhalb des Angriffsradius von wenigstens zwei Verbündeten befindet.

action->Rugged Travel.name: Geländemarsch
action->Rugged Travel.description: Kraschk ignoriert stets das erste Feld an Schwierigem Gelände im Rahmen von Laufen oder Schritt.

action->Inspired Recitation.name: Inspired Recitation
action->Inspired Recitation.description:
The mechanical assistant recites an inspiring poem, filling allies with determination and vigor. All allies within @Template[emanation|distance:60]{60 feet} gain a +1 status bonus to saving throws and 10 temporary Hit Points for 1 minute. Once an ally has benefited from this ability, they become temporarily immune to Inspired Recitation for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.MT5gxuuxBaN2RdYf]{Effect: Inspired Recitation}

equipment->Traveler's Any-Tool.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nNtakXnSrcXWndBV]

Before it's activated, this item appears to be an ash rod capped with steel on either end.

Activate 2 Interact, envision

Effect You imagine a specific simple tool, and the any-tool transforms into it. (Usually, you can choose from a tool listed in Chapter 6). This transforms the wooden portion into any haft and the metal caps into spades, hammer heads, or the like, allowing for most basic tools but nothing more complex. You can return the item to its rod form with an Interact action.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Noolik deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Tinker.name: Tinker
action->Tinker.description: A group of six jinkins can work together for an hour to imbue an item with a curse at a range of 60 feet. While this process is lengthy, it's also unobtrusive and can be performed while @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hiding}. Jinkins prefer to use this ability on magic items. The curse makes the item unreliable (@Check[flat|dc:5] or waste any action to Interact with or Activate the item), adds a bizarre requirement to use the item, or imparts some other curse of a similar caliber.

action->Trap Tinker.name: Trap Tinker
action->Trap Tinker.description: Noolik can cause a complex mechanical trap to continue longer than its normal duration. She moves up to her speed and Interacts with a trap. The trap can use its reaction during its next round as well as its routine, although its initiative doesn't change.

Sand Wolf.name: Sand Wolf
Sand Wolf.publicNotes:
A sand wolf is an elemental creature which dwells in the sandy deserts of elemental earth that drift to, or have been conjured on, the Plane of Air. Occasionally, these creatures seep through planar rifts or are summoned by elementalists on the Material Plane. Sand wolves are prized as guardians for their relative intelligence, keen perception, and ability to disguise themselves, easily blending with the shifting sands in desert terrain. Cunning and agile, they fiercely pursue any creatures they ambush, no matter how nimble their prey. Sand wolves also have a remarkable ability to sing beautiful, haunting songs, and their music is considered high entertainment among djinn who inhabit the Plane of Air. Many djinni viziers and even certain Material Plane rulers seeking the attention of their peers keep at least one of these creatures in their employ to show off at special events and ceremonies. The wolves' wordless songs evoke both the strength of the earth and the power of wind to erode it.

The Eternal Hourglass

Deep within a cavern in the Plane of Earth is a massive, seemingly indestructible hourglass the size of a small city, its top filled with thousands of sand wolves. As each wolf reaches the opening to the bottom, they are turned to sand and do not reform, instead piling up in a huge mound. It is not clear who constructed or placed the hourglass, how the sand wolves got there, or what—if anything—the hourglass is timing. Some claim the wolves will break loose and rampage freely when the sand runs out, while others believe the glass is counting down to the end of time itself.

action->Tremorsense 30 feet.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.j2wsK6IsW5yMW1jW]
Tremorsense 30 feet

action->Collapse Into Sand.name: Collapse Into Sand
action->Collapse Into Sand.description:
Trigger The sand wolf is hit by an attack

Effect The sand wolf's body falls apart into a cloud of sand. It takes no damage from the triggering attack, and its resistances increase to 8. The sand wolf must spend one action to reform its body before it can move or attack.

action->Water Vulnerability.name: Water Vulnerability
action->Water Vulnerability.description: Sand wolves take 5 additional damage from attacks and effects with the water trait.

action->Choking Sands.name: Choking Sands
action->Choking Sands.description:
The sand wolf discorporates into a cloud of whirling sand. It can Stride, moving freely through occupied spaces. Any creatures within those spaces take [[/r 2d10]] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Critical Success The target takes no damage.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, but the effect is increased to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}.

action->Susurrating Song.name: Susurrating Song
action->Susurrating Song.description:
The sand wolf sings a short, enchanting song. Any creature other than a sand wolf within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[will|dc:19] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to further susurrating song exposures for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.

Critical Failure As failure, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

equipment->Crude Wooden Religious Symbol.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]
Crude Wooden Religious Symbol of Sarenrae

equipment->Robes.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ilbLQNy6TbBPW7sQ]
Robes

Scrapborn.name: Scrapborn
Scrapborn.publicNotes:
In places where magic, alchemy, and engineering converge, there are often unforeseen side effects on the environment and its inhabitants. Scrapborn sometimes result from this strange convergence. Mostly, scrapborn appear to be walking piles of assorted junk, seemingly assembled at random. Their actual bodies are vaguely humanoid with delicate, spongy green skin. They secrete an adhesive that allows them to gather up debris and attach it to their bodies for protection. When these scraps eventually fall off, the scrapborn either reattaches them or replaces them with something new. Despite their resulting bulky appearance, scrapborn remain strong swimmers and display little loss of agility underwater. Scrapborn lack a centralized society, but sometimes congregate in small groups that work together for survival. Typically, this leads to ever-escalating attacks on nearby settlements as the creatures feed upon each other's resentment and work themselves up into a frenzy. They often target places with high-quality armor first so they can improve their odds of survival.

Pretend Knights

Some scrapborn spend a great deal of their time carefully selecting the pieces of armor and other bits they attach to their sticky skin. They might enjoy a particular color or material and cultivate their collection accordingly, striving for a cohesive design over time. A very diligent and patient—or particularly wealthy—scrapborn can even construct a full suit of armor this way and might even be able to pass as a knight, using their bulky armored form to bluff and intimidate anyone who might question them as they walk through a city or castle.

action->Sacrifice Armor.name: Sacrifice Armor
action->Sacrifice Armor.description:
Trigger The scrapborn is damaged by an attack dealing physical damage

Effect The scrapborn directs the damage to one of the pieces of scrap attached to its body and gains resistance 15 against the triggering attack, but its AC is lowered by 2 for 24 hours. The scrapborn's AC cannot be reduced below 16 in this way.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.1wCgwFLJByW8YKyM]{Effect: Sacrifice Armor}

action->Rebuild Armor.name: Rebuild Armor
action->Rebuild Armor.description:
Requirements The scrapborn's previous action was a successful claw Strike against a target wearing armor and that armor is not broken

Effect The scrapborn pulls and rips at the target's armor. The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target's armor takes @Damage[1d8[piercing]] damage, ignoring the armor's Hardness.

Failure The target's armor takes @Damage[2d8[piercing]] damage, which ignores the armor's Hardness; if this causes the armor to become broken, the scrapborn can incorporate the removed armor piece into its own body and raise its AC by 1 (to a maximum of 22).

Critical Failure As failure, except instead of damage, the target's armor is automatically reduced to its BT and the scrapborn increases its AC by 2.

spell->Plane Shift (to Astral Plane, Ele.name: <Compendium> (nur zur Astralebene, eine Elementarebene oder die Materielle Ebene)
spell->Plane Shift (to Astral Plane, Ele.target: 1 bereitwillige Kreatur oder bis zu 8 bereitwillige Kreaturen, die sich bei den Händen nehmen

consumable->Murderer's Knot.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YGaO4HyH6jn3P731]

Usage affixed to a weapon

Activate F Command

Trigger You damage an off-guard creature with a Strike using the Affixed weapon

Requirements You are an expert with the affixed weapon

This black strand of leather is tied to look like a peace knot when the weapon is stowed, but it doesn't hamper drawing the weapon. When you activate the knot, the creature you damaged takes @Damage[1d6[bleed]].

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.5Jc2ySGLVi053qpz]{Twist the Knife} feat, the talisman instead deals persistent bleed damage equal to your sneak attack damage.

action->Elemental Endurance.name: Elemental Endurance
action->Elemental Endurance.description: A janni can survive on any Elemental Plane for up to 48 hours, after which they take [[/r 1]]{1 damage} per hour until they leave or die.

action->Change Size.name: Change Size
action->Change Size.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The janni changes a creature's size. This works as a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:24] save negates).

The Enmity Cycle.name: The Enmity Cycle
The Enmity Cycle.description: Discordant music, dance, and poetry combine to build a deep suspicion and distrust of strangers.
The Enmity Cycle.disable: @Check[performance|dc:26] to counteract the performance or @Check[religion|dc:27] or @Check[occult|dc:27] to disrupt the spiritual energy. Three total successes are needed to disable the trap.
The Enmity Cycle.reset: A new production of The Enmity Cycle must be arranged; this process usually takes at least 1 week.
The Enmity Cycle.routine:
(1 action) The performance continues to sow seeds of enmity, discord, and distrust on those in its area. All creatures in attendance other than Zridi must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is immune to the effects for 1 day.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} for 2 rounds.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} for 1 minute and is certain the source of this fear is their fellow citizens, especially those from places other than their hometown. For 1 week the target suffers a –2 penalty to all Diplomacy skill checks against people from other Thuvian cities and regains the frightened 2 condition whenever they are in one of those cities.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target becomes a carrier for The Enmity Cycle for the next week. The target is compelled to travel to a city other than where they were exposed and recite as many lines from the anbarit as they can recall. Those who hear or witness the performance are treated as if they had attended a performance of The Enmity Cycle, but with a @Check[will|dc:23] save

action->Discordant Performance.name: Discordant Performance
action->Discordant Performance.description:
Trigger Zridi spends an action to activate The Enmity Cycle while in area F2

Effect All creatures other than Zridi in F2 take @Damage[(2d8+9)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:25|basic] save). The trap then rolls initiative.

equipment->Religious Symbol of Ahriman.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]
Religious Symbol of Ahriman
equipment->Religious Symbol of Ahriman.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]

This piece of wood or silver is emblazoned with an image representing a deity. Some divine spellcasters, such as clerics, can use a religious symbol of their deity as a divine focus to use certain abilities and cast some spells. A religious symbol must be held in one hand to use it.

action->Tripping Whip.name: Tripping Whip
action->Tripping Whip.description:
Requirements The Usij cultist must have a whip in their hands

Trigger A creature moves out of a threatened square

Effect The Usij cultist makes a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} attempt against the triggering creature with their whip.

action->Fox's Cunning.name: Fox's Cunning
action->Fox's Cunning.description: A vulpinal's core value is cunning. They can apply their knowledge and stories from their extensive travels to just about any situation in an instant. Before spending any other action on their turn, the vulpinal can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} as a free action.

spell->Misdirection (At Will) (Self Only.name: Misdirection (At Will) (Self Only)
spell->Misdirection (At Will) (Self Only.description: You reshape the magic aura of one creature or object to resemble that of another. You designate one target as the primary target and the other as the secondary target. Effects that would detect auras on the primary target instead detect the same types of auras from the secondary target. A creature reading the aura can attempt to disbelieve the illusion. You can Dismiss the spell from up to a mile away.

action->Hatred of Red.name: Hatred of Red
action->Hatred of Red.description: Pairakas hate the color red. Zridi won't wear the color or willingly enter any place painted red. Given a choice, she'll attack a creature wearing red first. If barred from expressing her displeasure toward the color by force or some magical effect, she takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage at the end of her turn.

action->Bubonic Plague.name: Bubonic Plague
action->Bubonic Plague.description:
A creature can't remove the fatigued condition while infected

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and take @Damage[1d6[bleed]] every [[/br 1d20 #Persistent Damage Interval]]{1d20 minutes} (1 day)

action->Change Shape.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

Zridi can take the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid or animal. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage modifiers with the Strikes, but it might change the damage type her Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Compelled Performance.name: Compelled Performance
action->Compelled Performance.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Zridi grants the target a +2 status bonus to Performance checks for one week. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save.

Critical Success No further effect.

Success The target must @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform} for 1 action on its next turn.

Failure The target must Perform for 3 actions on its next turn, undertaking a Performance task set by Zridi.

Critical Failure As failure, but Zridi can choose to delay the effect and trigger it at any point in the next week as a reaction.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Yb5rg3MEojIHQX8H]{Effect: Compelled Performance}

action->Tormenting Dreams.name: Tormenting Dreams
action->Tormenting Dreams.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Zridi torments a sleeping creature within 100 feet with visions of betrayals by loved ones and friends. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:26] save, with the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell.
